body_html:
I think yes as long as they don't crash I if variable scopes have no affect at least at what I have in mind atm that would work.

I can't say I'm a 100% sure which is the best solution, but I do think what you are saying - prefixing the name of the network by the parent scope - pretty much like the others to be a sound solution. This probably is fine even for anonymous networks to have it and is numbered. For the checkpoints, I don't think many users would care either way as long as it provides consistent saving and loading of models.

body:
I think yes as long as they don't crash I if variable scopes have no affect at least at what I have in mind atm that would work. 

I can't say I'm a 100% sure which is the best solution, but I do think what you are saying - prefixing the name of the network by the parent scope - pretty much like the others to be a sound solution. This probably is fine even for anonymous networks to have it and is numbered.  For the checkpoints, I don't think many users would care either way as long as it provides consistent saving and loading of models.
